Our results suggest that there is an association between CYP1A1 and an interaction between EPHX1 and NAT2 xenobiotic metabolism genes and an increased risk for clubfoot.
Data suggest that the exon 3 Tyr113His and exon 4 His139Arg polymorphisms of EPHXI may be associated with a increased risk of lung cancer and a worse prognosis.
combined genetic polymorphisms of GSTM1, GSTT1, GSTP1, and EPHX1 may have favorable effects on redox balance in chronic obstructive pulmonary disease patients.
Putative low EPHX1 enzyme activity may have a potential protective effect on tobacco-related carcinogenesis of lung and UADT cancers, whereas putative high EPHX1 activity may have a harmful effect
EPHX1 gene polymorphisms and haplotypes were not involved in the susceptibility to oral cancer in South Indian subjects.

Data indicate that further studies of EPHX1 rs1051740, ADH4 r1042364, and NQO1 rs291766 are needed to make more definitive conclusion on the role of variation in xenobiotic metabolism in ovarian cancer.
EPHX1 does not play a key role in mediating or predicting response to warfarin in an Italian population.
There was no association between mEH genotype and colorectal polyps, nor were any statistically significant gene-environment interactions identified.
EPHX1 polymorphism is associated with lung cancer susceptibility in Indian population.

Combined EPHX1, GSTP1, GSTM1, and GSTT1 genetic polymorphisms may play a signi fi cant role in the development of pulmonary emphysema.
A statistically significant difference is found between preeclampsia patients and controls as relates to EPHX1 exon 4 genotype.
Impact of genetic factors (VKORC1, CYP2C9, CYP4F2 and EPHX1) on the anticoagulation response to fluindione
individuals with EPHX1 113His/His slow activity genotype may not detoxify reactive carcinogenic epoxides efficiently, binding of reactive epoxides to DNA cause DNA damage.
There was no overall association between prostate cancer risk & functional polymorphisms of EPHX1 gene in exon 3 or 4. A significant interaction of smoking & the exon 4 polymorphism was present.
Polymorphism of microsomal epoxide hydrolase is associated with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease and bronchodilator response.
microsomal epoxide hydrolase polymorphism is associated with chromosomal instability of 1,3-butadiene exposed workers.
the present study revealed that EPHX1, UGT2B7 and SCN1A genetic polymorphisms simultaneously modulated the CBZ maintenance doses and CDRs(concentration-dose ratios)
EPHX1 gene polymorphisms and haplotypes are associated with an increased risk for alcoholism in the Kota Indian population
Exon 3 Tyr113His and exon 4 His139Arg polymorphisms of EPHX1 are risk factors for colorectal cancer in Turkey.

name: epoxide hydrolase 1

kegg.name: Metabolism of xenobiotics by cytochrome P450 - Homo sapiens (human)

wikipathways.name: Metapathway biotransformation Phase I and II

summary: Epoxide hydrolase is a critical biotransformation enzyme that converts epoxides from the degradation of aromatic compounds to trans-dihydrodiols which can be conjugated and excreted from the body. Epoxide hydrolase functions in both the activation and detoxification of epoxides. Mutations in this gene cause preeclampsia, epoxide hydrolase deficiency or increased epoxide hydrolase activity. Alternatively spliced transcript variants encoding the same protein have been found for this gene.[provided by RefSeq, Dec 2008].
